problem.p: An object moves in a straight line.
At the instant shown in the picture, compare the magnitude of its angular momentum about axes A through D.

choicegroup.choice: The angular momentum is zero about axes A through D.
The angular momentum is the same non-zero value for axes A through D.
The angular momentum is greatest for D, and smallest for A.
The angular momentum is greatest for A, and smallest for D.

problem.p: My answer to part 1 is justified because:

choicegroup.choice: The object is only translating and not rotating.
An observer in the x-y plane near axis A will see the object as moving more quickly than one near D.
An observer in the x-y plane near axis D will be farther from the object than one at A.
The axes shown are not in line with the center of the object.
The x component of the distance from the object to the axes is the same for all axes.
